alert.note: Alert for La Paz; Yuma (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Dust Storm Warning issued August 23 at 8:05PM MST until August 23 at 9:00PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: The National Weather Service in Phoenix has issued a * Dust Storm Warning for... Southwestern La Paz County in west central Arizona... Northern Yuma County in southwestern Arizona... Northeastern Imperial County in southeastern California... Riverside County in southern California... * Until 900 PM MST/900 PM PDT/. * At 805 PM MST/805 PM PDT/, a wall of dust was along a line extending from 6 miles northeast of Midland to 15 miles southeast of Ripley to 12 miles southwest of Kofa Wildlife Refuge to 21 miles northwest of Paloma, moving west at 25 mph. HAZARD...Near zero visibility with strong wind in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. * This includes the following highways... AZ Interstate 10 between mile markers 1 and 4. CA Interstate 10 between mile markers 120 and 156. AZ Interstate 8 between mile markers 29 and 35. Locations impacted include... Martinez Lake, Blythe, Wellton, Nicholls Warm Springs, Cibola, Palo Verde, Blythe Airport, Ripley, Yuma Proving Ground, Midland, East Blythe, Ehrenberg and Roll. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Dust storms lead to dangerous driving conditions with visibility reduced to near zero. If driving, avoid dust storms if possible. If caught in one, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.
